statements.name: PROC GPROJECT
statements.description: Identifies the input and output map data sets. Can specify the type of projection, and the criteria for clipping and projection.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: identifies the map data set that you want to process.

arguments.name: DATELINE
arguments.description: specifies that projections wrap from right to left at the international dateline.

arguments.name: DEGREES
arguments.description: specifies that the units for the longitude (X variable) and latitude (Y variable) coordinates are degrees.

arguments.name: DUPOK
arguments.description: specifies that observations are retained when their projected X and Y values are identical to those in the previous observation.

arguments.name: EASTLONG
arguments.description: specifies that the longitude (X variable) values in the input map data set increase to the east.

arguments.name: FROM=
arguments.description: invokes a proj.4 projection and specifies a coordinate system from which to start the projection.

arguments.name: LATLON
arguments.description: specifies that the LAT and LONG variables from the map data set are used for coordinate data instead of the Y and X variables.

arguments.name: LATMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum latitude that is included in the projection.

arguments.name: LATMIN=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum latitude that is included in the projection.

arguments.name: LONGMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum longitude to be included in the projection.

arguments.name: LONGMIN=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum longitude to be included in the projection.

arguments.name: MERIDIAN=
arguments.description: specifies the longitude value in degrees for the center of the projection.

arguments.name: NODATELINE
arguments.description: enables contiguous projections for maps that cross the line between 180 degrees and -180 degrees longitude.

arguments.name: NODUP
arguments.description: specifies that observations are deleted when their projected X and Y values are identical to those in the previous observation.

arguments.name: NOPARMIN
arguments.description: specifies that parameters should not be used from the PROJPARM data set.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output map data set.

arguments.name: PARADIV=
arguments.description: specifies the divisor that computes the values used for standard parallels for the Albers' or Lambert's projections when explicit values are not provided.

arguments.name: PARALLEL1=
arguments.description: specifies the value for the standard latitude parallel that is used in the Albers' or Lambert's projection.

arguments.name: R
arguments.description: is the range of latitude values in the input map data set.

arguments.name: P
arguments.description: is the PARADIV= value. (See the discussion of the option.)

arguments.name: minlat
arguments.description: is the minimum latitude value in the input map data set.

arguments.name: PARALLEL2=
arguments.description: specifies the value for the standard latitude parallel that is used in the Albers' or Lambert's projection.

arguments.name: R
arguments.description: is the range of latitude values in the input map data set.

arguments.name: P
arguments.description: is the PARADIV= value. (See the discussion of the option.)

arguments.name: maxlat
arguments.description: is the maximum latitude value in the input map data set.

arguments.name: PARMIN=
arguments.description: specifies a data set that contains input projection parameters.

arguments.name: PARMOUT=
arguments.description: creates a data set that contains the projection parameters for the current PROC GPROJECT statement.

arguments.name: PARMOUT
arguments.description: creates a data set that contains the projection parameters for the current PROC GPROJECT statement.

arguments.name: PARMENTRY=
arguments.description: specifies the entry in the projection parameters data set that is used for input parameters.

arguments.name: POLELAT=
arguments.description: each specifies a projection pole to use for the gnomonic projection.

arguments.name: POLELONG=
arguments.description: each specifies a projection pole to use for the gnomonic projection.

arguments.name: PROJECT=
arguments.description: specifies the projection method to apply to the map data set.

arguments.name: ALBERS
arguments.description: specifies Albers' equal-area projection with two standard parallels.

arguments.name: LAMBERT
arguments.description: specifies Lambert's conformal projection with two standard parallels.

arguments.name: GNOMON
arguments.description: specifies the gnomonic projection, which is an azimuthal projection.

arguments.name: PROJ4
arguments.description: specifies a transformation projection, the default being from EPSG:4386 (LAT and LONG) to 900913 (Mercator) coordinate system. These defaults can be overridden with the FROM= and TO= options.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that no projection should be performed. Use this option in conjunction with the LATMIN=, LATMAX=, LONGMIN=, and LONGMAX= options to perform clipping without projection.

arguments.name: RADIANS
arguments.description: specifies that the units for the longitude (X variable) and latitude (Y variable) coordinates are radians.

arguments.name: TO=
arguments.description: invokes the proj.4 projection and specifies a coordinate system for the result of the transforming projection.

arguments.name: WESTLONG
arguments.description: specifies that the longitude (X variable) values in the input map data set increase to the west.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: Identifies the variable or variables that define the hierarchy of the current unit areas in the input map data set.

arguments.name: id-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables in the input map data set that identify unit areas. Id-variable can be either numeric or character.
